page.title: 08MILVERTON NEWS IN JUNE
page.content:
ON MAY 30th 1985 THERE WAS A FIRE IN THE TOP BARN, GRATEFUL COTTAGE, MILVERTON, SOMERSET. THE FIRE WAS STARTED BY A PAINT STRIPPER GUN. MY MUM LEFT IT PLUGGED IN AND THE WIRE WAS ROUND THE STARTING BUTTON. SOMETHING JOGGED IT AND IT SWITCHED ON AND STARTED A FIRE. THE FIRE STARTED AT NIGHT AND WAS SEEN IN THE AFTERNOON.
THERE WERE 2 FIRE ENGINES AND 12 FIRE MEN. THE WINDOWS,THE ROOF AND THE FLOOR WERE BURNT. THE WALLS WERE COVERED IN BLACK SMOKE. OUR FRIDGE WAS BURNT AND A BRAND NEW PLAN PRINTER THAT WAS WORTH APPROXIMATELY Â£1,000. THE FIRE STARTED AT APPROXIMATELY 2.00AM. AFTERWARDS, ONLY THE WALLS AND HALF THE FLOOR WERE LEFT.
